channel.title: Wyatt's Blog
channel.description: Wyatt's blog for ravings, rants, and ruminations.
channel.copyright: 2024 Wyatt Ward. Do what you'd like, but I'd appreciate attribution..

item.title: All About Colour Management (As I Understand It)
item.description: A brief discussion about some topics in colour management and colourimetry - and the science of how to make different computers and displays show the same colours.

item.title: "Hug me Tight:" Reflections on Bubblegum Crisis, Episode 6: "Red Eyes" (1989)
item.description: Bubblegum Crisis 6: Red Eyes is reviewed and analyzed. This one didn't just touch me - it ripped me apart. Spoilers inside!

item.title: "We Shouldn't be Born to be Sad:" Reflections on Bubblegum Crisis, Episode 5: "Moonlight Rambler" (1988)
item.description: Bubblegum Crisis 5: Moonlight Rambler is reviewed. This episode touched me deeply. I do a thorough analysis and explain a lot of my personal philosophy. Spoilers inside!

item.title: Global Per-Keyboard Remapping: Inside and outside of X
item.description: Just a short follow-up post on the Unicomp article where I talk about how to remap a keyboard everywhere on a linux box. Works outside of X as well as inside.

item.title: Unicomp Returns to Form: My Thoughts on the Unicomp Mini M Keyboard
item.description: I bought a Unicomp "Mini M" buckling spring keyboard. First time I've bought a new tech product in quite a while (even if this is basically a remake of an old one).

item.title: The PowerBook G4 Story: Or: Squeezing Every Last Drop of Life out of Abandoned Hardware Platforms
Coercing RGB from Retro Video Game Consoles on the Cheap: Or: Modifying Game Consoles for Fun and Less Financial Damage
item.description: The retro video game market is stupidly priced these days. Here's some things I've done to save some money that I had fun doing. Also, SCART is overrated and unnecessary for RGB.

item.title: CDemu: A Brief Tour: Or: How I played Quake with the music CD on a computer without a CD Drive
item.description: Under Linux, CDEmu lets you do a lot of things - including CD music playback without having to have an analogue mixer in your sound card and output on your CD drive.

item.title: The POSIX Shell and You: Or: How You're Likely Misusing #!/bin/sh
item.description: The 'shebang' in Unix, its history, and why you should likely be using '#!/usr/bin/env bash' instead (or changing how you write your scripts).
